channel.title: Carter Keel Docs
channel.description: Recent content on Carter Keel Docs

item.title: Add Post To Docs
item.description:
Follow these steps to add a new post to the documentation website.

1. Pull the Repository

Clone or pull the latest version of the documentation repository from GitHub:

git pull origin main

2. Add a Markdown File

Create a new Markdown (.md) file in the following directory:

content/posts/

This file will contain the content of the new post. Use standard Markdown formatting. Include front matter at the top of the file, for example:

item.title: GitHub SSH Setup (Linux)
item.description:
Follow these steps to securely connect to GitHub using SSH on a Linux system.

üìå Prerequisites

  • A GitHub account

  • Git installed (sudo apt install git)

  • OpenSSH client installed (sudo apt install openssh-client)

üîë Step 1: Check for Existing SSH Keys

ls -al ~/.ssh

Look for files like id_rsa.pub or id_ed25519.pub. If they exist, you might already have an SSH key.

üõ†Ô∏è Step 2: Generate a New SSH Key

ssh-keygen -t ed25519 -C "your_email@example.com"

item.title: GitHub SSH Setup (Windows)
item.description:
Follow these steps to generate and use SSH keys on Windows for secure access to remote servers and services like GitHub, GitLab, or your own SSH server.

‚úÖ Prerequisites

  • Windows 10 or later

  • Access to Command Prompt or PowerShell

  • Git for Windows (includes ssh and ssh-keygen)

1. üß∞ Generate a New SSH Key

Open your terminal and run:

ssh-keygen -t ed25519 -C "your_email@example.com"

If your system doesn‚Äôt support ed25519, use:
